notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat JBoss Fuse and Red Hat JBoss A-MQ.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat JBoss Fuse, based on Apache ServiceMix, provides a small-footprint, flexible, open source enterprise service bus and integration platform. 

Red Hat JBoss A-MQ, based on Apache ActiveMQ, is a standards compliant messaging system that is tailored for use in mission critical applications.

This patch is an update to Red Hat JBoss Fuse 6.3 and Red Hat JBoss A-MQ 6.3. It includes bug fixes and enhancements, which are documented in the readme.txt file included with the patch files.

Security Fix(es):

* undertow: HTTP Request smuggling vulnerability (incomplete fix of CVE-2017-2666) (CVE-2017-7559)

* undertow: improper whitespace parsing leading to potential HTTP request smuggling (CVE-2017-12165)

* karaf: LDAP injection in LDAPLoginModule (CVE-2016-8750)

* plexus-utils: Mishandled strings in Commandline class allow for command injection (CVE-2017-1000487)

* poi: Parsing of multiple file types can cause a denial of service via infinite loop or out of memory exception (CVE-2017-12626)

The CVE-2017-7559 and CVE-2017-12165 issues were discovered by Stuart Douglas (Red Hat).
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat JBoss Fuse/A-MQ 6.3 R7 security and bug fix update

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an LDAP Query ('LDAP Injection')

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: Apache Karaf uses the LDAPLoginModule to authenticate users to a directory via LDAP. It does not, however, encode usernames properly and hence is vulnerable to LDAP injection attacks. While it appears that it is not possible to exploit this vulnerability to allow an attacker to gain remote access, it does allow an attacker to insert special characters into the search query step. Therefore, it can potentially be exploited as part of a Denial of Service attack.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

references.summary: bz#1524432: CVE-2016-8750 karaf: LDAP injection in LDAPLoginModule

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

Installation instructions are located in the download section of the customer portal.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2016-8750 karaf: LDAP injection in LDAPLoginModule

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request/Response Smuggling')

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: It was found that the fix for CVE-2017-2666 was incomplete and invalid characters are still allowed in the query string and path parameters. This could be exploited, in conjunction with a proxy that also permitted the invalid characters but with a different interpretation, to inject data into the HTTP response. By manipulating the HTTP response the attacker could poison a web-cache, perform an XSS attack, or obtain sensitive information from requests other than their own.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: undertow: HTTP Request smuggling vulnerability (incomplete fix of CVE-2017-2666)

notes.text: Apache POI in versions prior to release 3.17 are vulnerable to Denial of Service Attacks: 1) Infinite Loops while parsing crafted WMF, EMF, MSG and macros (POI bugs 61338 and 61294), and 2) Out of Memory Exceptions while parsing crafted DOC, PPT and XLS (POI bugs 52372 and 61295).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text: Plexus-utils before 3.0.16 is vulnerable to command injection because it does not correctly process the contents of double quoted strings.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
